data.title: Enable Debugging checkbox inverted
data.body: If you export and uncheck Enable Debugging, it exports using the debug version, and if you check it, it exports release version... :smile:

data.title: Overflow warning message during compilation
data.body:
Compiling latest HEAD on OS X I get the following warning message:

```
./servers/physics/collision_object_sw.h:85:45: warning: overflow in expression; result is 276447232 with type 'int'
      [-Winteger-overflow]
                if (p_transform.origin.length_squared() > MAX_OBJECT_DISTANCE_X2) {
                                                          ^
```

I don't know if it's harmless (if it is, sorry for the noise).

data.title: Better OS X fullscreen support, without the nasty startup effect
data.body: The key is to delay the set_window_fullscreen() call until all has been initialized.

data.title: Javascript build fails on Master
data.body:
scene/gui/check_box.cpp:62:13: error: cannot use dynamic_cast with -fno-rtti
        if (dynamic_cast< ButtonGroup\* >(parent))
            ^
1 error generated.

Please remove the -fno-rtti in platforms/javascript/detect.py or do not use the dynamic_cast test in this line.

data.title: HTML5 template is broken in 1.1rc2
data.body:
The html file exported refers to a js file that is generated at compile time. 
The js file is renamed while packaging the template. This should be done in the html file as well.

Please  use the following url to update building the template for html5.
https://github.com/vkbsb/godot/wiki/export_html5

Also here are the compiled javascript exporters for 1.1rc2
https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B_En8WVyy_2SflRHc3pzTFFfdUp5NmJSbmF1SHphNi1VX2c4NDdfV1RQNldvdlY3WVRJOTg&usp=sharing

data.title: RigidBody 3d Edge Collisions
data.body:
I have a simple box collision shape and then I slide a capsule (or sphere) over the top of it. Everything works well until the capsule gets to the edge of the box and tries to slide off the side. The capsule gets stuck and slides along the edge and not off the side as expected. An example project that shows this behavior can be found here:

http://dreamsage.com/fps1.zip

Tested on Win7 64 on v1.1 RC2

data.title: Possible website fixes
data.body:
Hi there,

Two things that I've reported on IRC already but I guess an issue is better to keep track of them and make sure they are not forgotten:
- On the main page ( http://www.godotengine.org/wp/ ), clicking "Recent News" at the top of the left column brings to a 404 page. The link should point to wp/blog instead of wp/news.
- On the download page ( http://www.godotengine.org/wp/download/ ), after the "Latest Release" section, there is a "Development Release" section that points to 1.0devel. It should probably be moved to the bottom of the column, since most people who are not looking for the latest release might look for 1.0stable and not 1.0devel.

data.title: Really fixes fullscreen mode in OS X, even during startup
data.body: This PR should works even during project startup.

data.title: Fixes fullscreen mode in OS X
Sprite.set_flip_h() now requires bool?
data.body:
I'm not sure when this changed, but 0 and 1 used to be automatically interpreted as boolean values by the set_flip_h function. For example, this line of code was working in older versions of Godot:

obj.set_flip_h( randi() % 2 )

But now, it must be cast to bool or the game dies when that line is hit, like so:

obj.set_flip_h( bool(randi() % 2) )

It's obviously an easy fix, but seems unnecessary since it was previously working and makes sense that it was working with 0/1 integers. I'm going to assume this applies to other functions with bool arguments, though I did not test more yet.

Was this change intentional? If it was, what was the reasoning behind it? And maybe - for cleaner code's sake - we could add a randb() which returns a random bool?

obj.set_flip_h( randb() )

data.title: editor_settings.xml is mercilessly wiped out when opened in Godot < 1.1beta
data.body:
If you launch an older Godot build, such as the 1.0 release, it will completely destroy the editor_settings.xml file, all the while printing out a warning that the file is too new, and to use a newer version of Godot in the terminal output.

Perhaps newer versions of Godot should have their own versioned config (editor_settings_1.1.xml, for example), which, if not already present, could be copied from the first existing previous version (just decrement the minor and major version numbers from current version down to 1.1, and finally, editor_settings.xml, until one is found, if any). Then this annoyance can be avoided going forward.

data.title: Pr-Tween-fix
data.body: Spine: add feature to insert/remove interpolates while updating

data.title: All Uses-Permission (AndroidManifest) was written. Can't be changed via Editor
data.body:
So, I build an Apk (of course I'm in Android Platform), All uses-permission for AndroidManifest was written like crazy. I do any change by selecting what I need via check button (bool type) inside Editor. But, my change was always be ignored.

I don't know if this happen on Godot v1.0 Stable. I just test it inside Godot v1.1Beta1 and v1.1RC1 on Android Build. Let's have the image below :

![uses-permission_overloaded_androidmanifest_gdt-1 1beta1 1 1rc1_bug_01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244526/7465978/8159b830-f30d-11e4-9fea-76d6ad1ce3a1.png)

![uses-permission_overloaded_androidmanifest_gdt-1 1beta1 1 1rc1_bug_02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12244526/7465982/8b586ebc-f30d-11e4-94fe-ac18f041f97e.JPG)

data.title: AnimationPlayer playing animation in reverse problem.
data.body: animation speed set to -1 should play animation in reverse from the end to the start. At least it does, when animation is looped. When it is not looped, animation does not play, and playhead stays at the first frame.

data.title: Fullscreen doesn't work in OS X
data.body:
Setting Scene -> Project Settings -> display -> fullscreen to "on", doesn't do anything in OS X. Pressing F5 or F6 runs the project/scene windowed.

It works well on Linux, though.

(I'm using OS X Yosemite (10.10.3).)

data.title: Fixes Theora build
data.body: Changes memcpy() -> copymem(). Fixes #1806.

data.title: Unable to convert String to float using float(String)
data.body:
According to https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/class_float, I can convert a String into a float using the function:

```
float float(String from)
```

However, if I try this simple example:

```
var f = float("25")
```

I get the following error message:

```
Invalid call. Unexisting 'float' constructor.
```

data.title: Quick open scene doesn't work for scenes created in current editor run
data.body:
How to reproduce:
- Open a project
- Create a scene on a non root directory
- Save it
- Quick open scene

The path will be incorrect (root instead of a sub-directory) in the quick open dialog and trying to open the scene will fail.

Workaround:
Restarting the editor will correctly display the scene in the quick scene open dialog.
Opening the scene directly works

makes WinMain() and main() accepts unicode characters into arguments

fixes issue #1693
